title: ICE using associated type in trait bound

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: A-associated-items
labels.description: Area: Associated items such as associated types and consts.

body:
It actually happens even if you take out the `type T` but I figured that would be too confusing of a testcase.

``` rust
#![feature(associated_types)]

pub trait Foo {
    type T;
    type S: Bar<Self::T>;
}

pub trait Bar<T> {}
```

``` console
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: http://doc.rust-lang.org/complement-bugreport.html
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
```
